channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Driver struggles to reverse jet ski trailer down a boat ramp leaving onlookers in fits of laughter
item.description: A black pickup truck tried and failed multiple times to reverse its jet ski trailer down a ramp at Canyon Lake in Texas. Onlookers laughed hysterically as the trailer jackknifed more than once on the descent.

item.title: Thomas Becket's 800-year-old shrine is digitally brought to life
item.description: The stunning CGI reconstruction of the shrine at Canterbury Cathedral uses new evidence to show how it would have appeared before its destruction almost 500 years ago.

item.title: Boris Johnson accuses care home bosses of failing to look after their residents during the pandemic
item.description: Prime Minister Boris Johnson provoked an angry dispute last night after he accused care homes of failing to look after their residents properly during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: US team set to take 'one last roll of the dice' at solving Annie McCarrick disappearance case
item.description: US lawyer Michael Griffith told The Herald his team have now identified 'one main suspect' in the case of Annie McCarrick, from New York, after uncovering a witness statement that was overlooked.

item.title: NHS worker slammed for skipping supermarket queues despite showing her priority badge
item.description: An anonymous woman, who works for the NHS, asked users of UK online forum Mumsnet whether those working on the frontline should be allowed to continue to skip supermarket queues.

item.title: Brazilian mother strangles son, 11, to death because he kept playing on his phone
item.description: Police in Brazil said they charged Alexandra Dougokenski with Rafael's murder on Thursday, July 2 after she confessed to the shocking crime.

item.title: Protests erupt in Phoenix after cops gun down man in parked car
item.description: The officer-involved shooting death of an armed man who was sitting inside a parked car in Phoenix has prompted protests to erupt across the city.

item.title: Brazil's President Bolsonaro is tested for coronavirus for a fourth time
item.description: Bolsonaro has repeatedly played down the impact of the virus, even as Brazil has suffered one of the world's worst outbreaks, with more than 1.6 million confirmed cases and 65,000 related deaths.

item.title: Where to buy face masks in the UK: Best re-usable and surgical face coverings online
item.description: Wondering where to buy a face mask or face covering in the UK? Wearing face coverings in shops will also be mandatory from 10 July.

item.title: 'Miracle Mal' Martin left in tears as he returns home while neighbours applaud him
item.description: Mal Martin, from Cardiff, who spent 61 days fighting for his life on a ventilator as he battled coronavirus, has returned home. Neighbours flooded the streets to applaud his recovery.

item.title: Three quarters of people who live with a coronavirus sufferer may develop 'silent' immunity
item.description: The number who have suffered Covid-19 may have been hugely underestimated because tests are looking for specific antibodies in blood rather than the body's 'memory' T cells.

item.title: Twenty Saudi nationals are named on UK sanctions list of human rights abusers
item.description: Dominic Raab yesterday unveiled a list of 49 individuals responsible for human rights abuses who are to be sanctioned. They are from Russia, Saudi Arabia, Myanmar and North Korea.

item.title: Duchess of Cornwall tells of her love for rescue dogs Beth and Bluebell in radio interview
item.description: Camilla, 72, will discuss the pooches she rescued from Battersea Dogs Home in London as she undertakes her first-ever radio guest edit on BBC Radio 5 Live's The Emma Barnett Show on Tuesday.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle join video call on equal rights
item.description: The Duke of Sussex, 35, made the comment as he joined wife Meghan Markle, 38, for a video call with young leaders from the Queen's Commonwealth Trust last week.

item.title: Kanye West and Donald Trump's law firm among 700,000 firms getting PPP loans
item.description: The Trump administration on Monday revealed how a firehose of $521.4 billion in taxpayer cash washed across the landscape of America's small businesses.

item.title: Hundreds of royal staff 'are being axed with up to 250 offered voluntary redundancy'
item.description: Up to 250 royal staff look set to lose their jobs this month as the Queen's finances continue to feel the impact of coronavirus crisis, with doubts over whether the Queen will return to London.

item.title: Former MI6 spy's dossier sparks Huawei storm over 'useful idiots' claims
item.description: Among a string of incendiary claims, the dossier described the Chinese telecoms firm as 'Beijing's strategic asset'. Pictured: Alleged target Sir Kenneth Olisa with the Duchess of Cambridge.

item.title: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo says US is 'looking into' banning TikTok
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said late on Monday that the United States is 'certainly looking at' banning Chinese social media apps, including TikTok.

item.title: Tory MP to cancel licence fee after BBC podcast on: 'How can white women not be Karens?'
item.description: Several MPs have slammed the BBC on social media for its No Country For Young Women podcast, where presenter Sadia Azmat asked: 'How can white women not be Karens?'

item.title: UN slams Donald Trump for killing Iranian General Soleimani in drone strike
item.description: The January U.S. drone strike in Iraq that killed top Iranian general Qassem Soleimani and nine others represented a violation of international law, a U.N. human rights investigator said on Monday.

item.title: Green for go! Rishi Sunak's £3billion eco jobs boost with workers paid to plant trees
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak has set aside £3billion for a green employment package focused on cutting emissions, improving the environment and creating jobs across Britain.

item.title: Norman Conquest made pork more popular in England, remains show
item.description: Researchers from Bristol, Cardiff and Sheffield Universities studied human remains, animal bones and ceramic cookware from Oxford around the time of the invasion.

item.title: Ex-fiance of Eastenders star Gillian Taylforth is 'shot in stomach outside Toby Carvery'
item.description: Dave Fairbairn, pictured with Gillian Taylforth, was shot at close range near a Toby Carvery car park in Enfield, North London, but the bullet missed his major organs.

item.title: TikTok says it will stop its app from working in Hong Kong following 'recent events'
item.description: TikTok said it was was 'stopping operations' in Hong Kong' in light of 'recent events' - referring to a new law which critics say will allow Communist Party-controlled courts to punish dissent.

item.title: Rishi Sunak 'will implement a stamp duty cut immediately'
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak's crucial coronavirus recovery package is expected to include a six-month 'holiday' from the charge on most homes to kick-start the market.

item.title: Perth participant in COVID-19 human vaccine trial reveals why she wanted to be a guinea pig
item.description: Rachelle Kalic joined a human trial to develop a COVID-19 vaccine because she wants her father to have a job again driving Ubers.

item.title: Two US Navy aircraft carriers conduct exercises in the South China Sea
item.description: Two US Navy aircraft carriers are conducting exercises in the contested South China Sea just days after Beijing threatened to destroy the strike group.

item.title: PM calls for driverless trains as condition of future...
item.description: The Government gave Transport for London a £1.6 billion package to continue running services after a collapse in revenue in May.
item.media:description: Boris Johnson wants to see driverless trains on the TfL network (Jonathan Brady/PA)

item.title: Italy allows rescue ship Ocean Viking to dock after week long stand-off
item.description: After being rescued in four separate operations on June 25 and 30, the migrants waiting on the ship in Italy became increasingly agitated, with suicide attempts and bouts of violence.

item.title: Teen reveals she tested POSITIVE for COVID-19 the day after getting a nose job
item.description: TikTok user @lsdbebe, from the US, opened up about the situation in a viral video, which has been viewed more than three million times since it was posted last week.

item.title: William and Harry agree to split Diana memorial fund
item.description: An agreement between the Royal Foundation of the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and the now abandoned Sussex Royal Foundation was signed in December last year, financial documents show.

item.title: Melbourne goes back into lockdown
item.description: Thirteen new cases are linked to nine Melbourne tower blocks which have suffered 69 cases and been placed under hard lockdown since Saturday.
item.media:credit: Matrix News for Daily Mail Australia

item.title: Meghan Markle 'ditched her best friend Jessica Mulroney to look woke'
item.description: Canadian stylist Jessica Mulroney, 40, is said to be 'distraught and devastated' at having been 'ditched' by close friend Meghan Markle, 38, following a racism controversy last month.

item.title: Woman recalls the heart-wrenching moment she found her mother after an attempted suicide
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: In an extract from Cruel: One Child's Story To Survive, Denise Richardson, now 48, recalls the day she came home from school to find her mother collapsed at their West Midlands home.

item.title: Melbourne residents refuse to tell close contacts they've caught coronavirus
item.description: Residents in Melbourne are refusing to tell health officials who their close contacts are despite a huge surge in coronavirus cases.

item.title: Kate Garraway told to 'get on with her life and return to work' by doctors
item.description: Kate Garraway has admitted her husband's doctors have told her she must not put her 'life on pause' as her husband Derek Draper continues to battle coronavirus.

item.title: Halle Berry issues apology after backlash for saying she 'might' play a transgender male
item.description: Halle Berry was the target of online outrage over the weekend, after revealing on Instagram Live that she 'might' be playing the role of a transgender male in an upcoming film.

item.title: Computer says NO! People reveal VERY amusing software failures
item.description: The collection of snaps from around the world,, collated by Bored Panda, include broken maps on delivery and taxi apps, as well as a heart rate tracker which bizarrely thinks having 0 bpm is 'great'.

item.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda responds online to criticism that his musical Hamilton glorifies slave owners
item.description: The 40-year-old playwright took to social media Monday to respond to critics calling for Hamilton to be canceled for its glorification of slave owners.

item.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda responds online to criticism that his musical Hamilton glorifies slave owners
item.description: The 40-year-old playwright took to social media Monday to respond to critics calling for Hamilton to be canceled for its glorification of slave owners.

item.title: World's longest surviving conjoined twins worked carnival sideshow act die at the age of 68
item.description: Donnie and Ronnie Gaylon the world's oldest living conjoined twins died on July 4, 2020 at the age of 68 in Dayton,Ohio. The brothers spent their life performing as a sideshow act in carnivals.

item.title: Routine face-to-face appointments with your GP may never return
item.description: The number of in-person GP appointments dropped from 70 per cent to 23 per cent 'within weeks' of measures being adopted in response to the virus, a report from the RCGP said.

item.title: TikTok home cook shares her simple one-pan recipe for the perfect egg sandwich
item.description: A home cook, from Malaysia, has shared her simple one-pan recipe for the perfect cheese toastie - complete with an egg omelette and ham.

item.title: Woman loses job after attacking pubgoer for 'speaking Polish'
item.description: The alleged attacker today insisted she hadn't used those words and she revealed she had been sacked today from her job as a recruitment consultant after the footage went viral.

item.title: Plans to allow takeaway alcohol will lead to more street violence, ministers are warned
item.description: Reforms contained in the the Business and Planning Bill include allowing British pubs and bars, currently barred from doing so, to sell alcohol for consumption off the premises.

item.title: Widow of late Broadway star Nick Cordero breaks down in tears as she hosts heart-breaking singalong
item.description: Amanda Kloots took to Instagram Live earlier this afternoon to perform a heart-breaking rendition of Cordero's original song, 'Live Your Life', for the final time - just one day after his death.

item.title: Did fiancé who killed millionaire children's author Helen Bailey murder his first wife too?
item.description: Ian Stewart, rhe fiance who killed children's author Helen Bailey, appeared in court yesterday accused of previously murdering his wife. At the time it was recorded as 'death by epilepsy'.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: PAUL THOMAS on the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell: 'The FBI requests the pleasure of your company at the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell'

item.title: Kasabian star Tom Meighan is scheduled to appear in court on domestic assault charge
item.description: The 39-year old's abrupt departure from the group he helped form as a teenager was confirmed in a public statement released by his band-mates on Monday.

item.title: Wedding guest's revealing outfit sparks outrage online as critics slam her for upstaging the bride
item.description: All eyes are supposed to be on the bride on her wedding day, but critics say that couldn't have been the case at a ceremony in Poland where a guest donned a lingerie-inspired red ballgown.

item.title: Headteacher, 40, who murdered estranged wife 39, and her lover, 48, was a 'cowardly bully'
item.description: Rhys Hancock, 40, stabbed Helen Almey, 39, and Martin Griffiths, 48, to death. A friend of Ms Almey said Hancock was a bully and a coward' and ambulances and police were called to their house.

item.title: Abandoned black Labrador found tied to railings in Kent, with note asking kennels to take him
item.description: The black Labrador was left attached by his collar to a mental gate outside Jasmil Kennels in Upchurch near Sittingbourne, Kent.

item.title: How to fold a fitted sheet in SECONDS: Mum wows the internet with her 'game-changing' method
item.description: A mother has wowed the internet with her simple four-step method for folding a fitted sheet in seconds - with many dubbing it a 'game changer'.

item.title: Return of the drugged-up illegal raves that should make every parent shudder
item.description: Welcome to the illicit world of the UK's burgeoning quarantine rave culture - one of the ugliest and most disturbing by-products of the nation's 14-week coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Horrifying moment woman slams into patio shelter as she tries to jump from rooftop into a pool
item.description: A man and woman prepare to jump off the roof of a home and into a pool. The man succeeds but the woman hesitates and end up slamming into a shelter before splashing into the water.

item.title: Herd immunity to coronavirus may be 'unachievable' because 5% of people in Spain have antibodies
item.description: At least 60% of people need to have contracted coronavirus for it to not be able to spread throughout a community, but a new study has found that only 5% of people in Spain have antibodies.

item.title: SEBASTIAN SHAKESPEARE: Roxy Music star Andy Mackay wants the Soho party over
item.description: Andy Mackay favoured sporting silver jumpsuits alongside fellow band member Bryan Ferry. He now seems to have undergone a metamorphosis into a grumpy old man.

item.title: Three pubs are forced to close because customers test positive for coronavirus
item.description: The Lighthouse in Burnham-on-Sea, Somerset, the Fox & Hounds, in Batley, West Yorkshire and The Village Home in Alverstoke, Hampshire are the first pubs in England to close.

item.title: Woman in her 50s dies and man in his 20s is taken to hospital 'after going into sea to rescue dog'
item.description: A woman in her 50s died after going into the sea in Wirral to rescue a struggling dog on Monday. Emergency services were called to New Brighton seaside resort at around 12.30pm.

item.title: As the Covid crisis deepened, the nation's favourite farming soap shut up shop
item.description: STEPHEN GLOVER: Though no official figures are yet available, once-faithful fans are said to be deserting the nearly 70 year-old BBC Radio Four show, The Archers, in droves.

item.title: Thousands of teens are at risk of slipping into a world of gangs and drugs due to lockdown
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of teenagers are in danger of becoming a 'lost generation' - slipping into lives of crime and idleness due to lockdown, says the Children's Commissioner Anne Longfield.

item.title: ANOTHER 'explosive' book hits the Trumps: Melania will be subject of tell-all by former best friend
item.description: Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, a close friend of Melania Trump and a former adviser to the East Wing, will release a memoir detailing her friendship with the first lady this fall.

item.title: Why squatting stretches could add years to your life
item.description: The idea comes from a recent study, published in the journal Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, which looked at the habits of the Hadza tribe who live in Tanzania, East Africa.

item.title: Fair, female and 40 - that's why Julie had gallstones, but her doctor insisted it was just anxiety
item.description: JULIE COOK: The pain radiating from my abdomen was worse than childbirth. It began on Christmas Eve. I was at home with our children while my husband - a musician - was at work.

item.title: Indian-born billionaire started Boohoo at Manchester market
item.description: Before Boohoo shot onto the ever-growing fast fashion scene, its owner Mahmud Kamani, 55, ran a Manchester market stall. His sons Adam and Umar launched Pretty Little Thing in 2012.

item.title: Katie Price is left 'devastated' as her £1.3m 'mucky mansion' is 'destroyed by intruders'
item.description: The 42-year-old glamour model, who is currently renting a house nearby, is said to be 'devastated' after learning that the ground floor ceiling has collapsed, wrecking her brand new kitchen.

item.title: How can I avoid a knee replacement? DR MARTIN SCURR answers your health questions
item.description: DR MARTIN SCURR: Osteoarthritis begins with inflammation, and leads to the gradual loss of cushioning cartilage from the end of the bones that comprise the joint.

item.title: Meghan Markle left Kate Middleton 'upset' with 'rant' at staff
item.description: The Duchess of Sussex, 38, is 'very sensitive' about being 'number two' to Kate Middleton, 38, after joining 'alien environment' of The Firm, royal author Tom Quinn told the Daily Star Online.

item.title: Now more British women say they're victims of Jeffrey Epstein after the arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
item.description: US lawyer Gloria Allred, who represents 16 of the paedophile's victims, said a number of women from the UK had contacted her in recent days to make claims against Jeffrey Epstein's estate

item.title: RICHARD KAY: Prince Andrew's silence is ruinously damaging his mother
item.description: RICHARD KAY: Day after day, news of exasperating royal behaviour has thudded on to Britain's breakfast tables to the despair of the Queen. Every morning seems to bring news about Andrew.

item.title: British gymnasts who competed at Olympics and Commonwealth Games in abuse and bullying claims
item.description: Gymnastics champion Lisa Mason, who competed for Britain at the Sydney Olympics, is among those claiming she suffered abused, some of which she says occurred aged 10.

item.title: Superbugs pose a grave threat to Britain's cancer patients, experts fear
item.description: As many as 2,985 people in England died from antibiotic-resistant infections in 2018; and 60,788 patients were infected - a rise of nearly ten per cent over the previous year.

item.title: EDWARD LUCAS: At last! The end of the age of appeasing Beijing bullies
item.description: EDWARD LUCAS: China's plan for world domination faces a hitch. That is the upshot of our Government's impending decision to curb Huawei's role in our next-generation 5G mobile data network.

item.title: Hi-tech T-shirt packed with tiny sensors that can help diagnose the menopause
item.description: The garment is worn round the clock to measure changes in temperature and identify sweating caused by the hot flushes many menopausal women suffer.

item.title: David Walliams' book publisher says 'racist' character is WHITE
item.description: HarperCollins responded by saying Jack Monroe's tweets were factually inaccurate. They said the character Monroe claims has 'racist undertones' because of her 'big frizzy hair' is actually white.

item.title: Can shining a light in your ear REALLY stop you feeling tired?
item.description: Can a supplement or gadget stop you feeling tired? Dr Najia Shaikh, an NHS GP based in London and at the One Skin Clinic in Harley Street, assessed products that claim to help to do just that.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: There's nothing normal about the new normal
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: My worry is that enforcement will remain inconsistent as restrictions are lifted. I warned you that the 'new normal' would be worse than lockdown. So it is proving.

item.title: Father of paramedic stabbed in the chest says attack was 'completely random'
item.description: Mother-of-three Deena Evans (pictured), 39, and a male colleague were stabbed while responding to a home in Wolverhampton.

item.title: CRAIG BROWN: Do historians have to be so horribly catty?
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: Recent events have convinced me that, when it comes to cattiness, one profession beats all others hands down. I am talking of historians.

item.title: Brent Cross floods as water main bursts on North Circular Road
item.description: A burst water main has flooded a carriageway on the North Circular leaving many drivers trapped in their cars.

item.title: Former Miss Colombia shows off dance moves after amputating her left foot and part of her left leg
item.description: More than 2.6 million views have been generated by a video shared on Instagram on Sunday that shows former Miss Colombia Daniella Álvarez dancing after undergoing an amputation.

item.title: Former Miss Colombia shows off dance moves after amputating her left foot and part of her left leg
item.description: More than 2.6 million views have been generated by a video shared on Instagram on Sunday that shows former Miss Colombia Daniella Álvarez dancing after undergoing an amputation.

item.title: Leading authors urge Booker Prize bosses to reinstate Baroness Nicholson
item.description: Tory peer Baroness Nicholson allegedly 'misgendered' transgender model Munroe Bergdorf and was axed from her Booker role. But a group of authors say they are 'dismayed' at the decision.

item.title: Bride demands her sister pay $600 for her wedding dress alterations because she gained weight
item.description: Reddit user Fun-Line7588 shared her story on the 'Am I the A**hole' forum, explaining she offered to buy her sister her 'dream wedding dress' as an early wedding present.

item.title: Kanye West shares photo of his shelters in progress as part of his '2020 vision'
item.description: The rapper shocked the world by announcing last week that he was running for president. On Sunday, he tweeted a photo of his 'shelter', writing: 'YZY SHLTRS in process #2020VISION'.

item.title: Disney actor Sebastian Athie who starred in O11CE dies at 24
item.description: Disney actor Sebastian Athie died at the age of 24 over the weekend. The star, who was born in Mexico, was best known for playing Lorenzo Guevara on the Argentine TV series O11CE.

item.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard lawyers seek to avoid confrontation
item.description: Lawyers for the warring former couple have been working to make sure they arrive at the High Court at separate times for the showdown to ensure there is no risk of them bumping into one another outside.

item.title: Long Lost Family: Adopted grandmother breaks down in tears after visiting late father's grave
item.description: Kathleen Fraser Jackson, 63, from Wembley, north west London, was put up for adoption at just three-months-old. She appeared on Long Lost Family tonight to discover more about her father's side.

item.title: De Blasio blamed over NY police budget as gun violence surges
item.description: NYPD Commissioner Dermot Shea attacked Mayor Bill de Blasio's police reforms on Monday after New York City saw 63 people shot and 11 killed in shootings over the holiday weekend.

item.title: Lord Clement-Jones 'baffled' by fake Huawei campaign revelation
item.description: Lord Clement-Jones, a Liberal Democrat, was allegedly targeted in a covert bid to invite British politicians and business leaders to take part in staged radio interviews and email them fake news.

item.title: Bubba Wallace accuses Donald Trump of 'hate' after comments
item.description: Bubba Wallace accused President Donald Trump of 'hate' toward him and said he would respond to that with 'love.' 'Always deal with the hate being thrown at you with LOVE!,' he tweeted.

item.title: Pregnant woman poses with thousands of BEES on her stomach
item.description: Bethany Karulak-Baker, a beekeeper from Steamboat Springs, Colorado,, posted for the shocking maternity shoot. 'We just dumped the bees on me and they naturally began to beard,' she said.

item.title: Broadway show Hamilton faces calls to be 'canceled'
item.description: Alexander Hamilton advocated against slavery several times during his life, but often side-lined the issue in order to win the approval of wealthy or powerful benefactors and advance himself.

item.title: Ofcom could throw Chinese TV station off air over show trial
item.description: British broadcasting watchdog Ofcom today revealed it was considering sanctions following complaints of two news reports on the case of Peter Humphrey in China on CCTV news.

item.title: Photo of golden-crowned flying fox bat scares social media
item.description: While the picture, taken in the Philippines, appears to show a 'human-size' horror hanging upside down from a roof, it is actually a clever camera trick.

item.title: Man who organised Anni Dewani murder freed after HALF sentence
item.description: Zola Tongo, a taxi driver, who was jailed for 18 years for his part in the murder of Anni Derwani in South Africa in 2010, is to walk free from jail on July 28 after serving just over half of his sentence.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's 'secret stash of Jeffrey Epstein sex tapes'
item.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, 58, has a secret stash of Jeffrey Epstein's twisted sex tapes, a former friend exclusively revealed to DailyMail.com.

item.title: David Starkey apologises for `so many damn blacks´ comment
item.description: The historian and presenter, 75, made the comments during an online interview with Brexit campaigner Darren Grimes for YouTube channel Reasoned UK.

item.title: Earth's magnetic field changes 10 times faster than thought
item.description: UK scientists have simulated the swirling flow of iron 1,740 miles below the planet's surface, which creates the electric currents that power the field, going back 100,000 years.

item.title: Make-up artists share contouring tip for slimmer nose with FORK
item.description: TikTok user Ellie Trimarchi, from Sydney, amazed the video sharing app with her simple hack for contouring your nose with a fork, using the prongs as a guide when applying the darker and lighter shades.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: 15 new fatalities in preliminary death toll
item.description: Department of Health data shows the rolling seven-day average of Covid-19 fatalities in the UK has now dropped to 95 - 20 per cent lower than the 117 for last Monday.

item.title: Romanian woman runs for life after posing with BEAR for photo
item.description: A woman in Bacău, Romania, fled in terror as a bear she tried to pose next to for a picture lunged at her. The woman in white and blue managed to escape unharmed.
